data.title: soup for lunch
data.text: I had the Won Ton soup for lunch, it was just OK, nothing special. I've had better at other Asian restaurants around town.

data.title: A nice supper.
data.text: There are 3 Asian restaurants in this small shopping center.  We chose Cafe Fusion basically on the flip of a coin but we were pleased with our non-choice.  My wife had sweet and sour chicken and I had sweet and sour tofu (vegetarian).  The order was taken quickly and the food came in a reasonable time.  We meant to ask about the use of MSG but forgot to do so.  The food was very good.  My wife's food was hot but mine was merely warm.  Strange.  It was filling enough so that some was taken home.

data.title: Great food, so-so service
data.text: I always enjoy eating here, even when someone manages to bump me off of my go to option, the terrific pad thai.  My only gripe is service, which is rudimentary at best.  Servers should say "hello," and make eye contact, and ask if the food is okay, and not just place a couple of sets of cutlery on the edge of the table. I had to ask for the check, and ask for boxes, and ask for a bag in which to put the boxes.   I left a ten percent tip because it didn't seem like my young server cared if I was there or not.

data.title: Amazing soup!
data.text: We stopped for dinner while traveling from Michigan to Colorado. The food was terrific! The Tom Kah was absolutely delicious!!!

data.title: Discover a Gem!  Have lunch or dinner here!
data.text: We stopped in for lunch on a whim and are so glad we did.  The food was delicious, beautifully presented, and Mollie was an enthusiastic ambassador helping us to choose each dish.  We are intrigued to try many more.  We had the Pad Thai with shrimp after Crab Rangoon and spring roll appetizers.  There are many different options on the menu and we look forward to trying more.  We learned we can bring our own wine free of charge if we come in the evening.   Don't pass up this healthy and tasty alternative in Des Moines!

data.title: Fresh, flavorful, authentic
data.text: Best summer rolls and Pho in the city. Very accommodating for gluten free diners. Extremely reasonable in price, and if you choose to dine there, it is BYOB, so tote your own favorite wine or beer to the restaurant if you like.

data.title: My go-to for Southeast Asian cuisine
data.text:
I have been going to this place since it opened, and usually order the same dish. I have tried much of the menu, (lad na with beef), and while I'm not a huge fan of Phở, theirs is the best in town by a long shot. My wife often gets the chicken Pad Thai, and my kids all love the beef lo mein. We all love the dragon wings, and my kids are especially partial to the shrimp dumplings.
The prices have recently increased, but they're still on par with what is expect to pay for a good meal.

data.title: Flavor...Flavor...Flavor
data.text: San is the Master Chef of Fuzion sauces!!   We discovered this great cafe years ago/  The decor is freshened often, so does his tasty menu!  Lot's of flavor here, he will even customize your choices, if a particular ingrediant does not work with your gastro system, who does that anymore!!  We love Cafe Fusion!!

data.title: Not Quite
data.text: We had hoped for better tasting Asian food, but it was just o.k.  The staff was welcoming, the menu extensive, the decor better than most, but the food...  The Spring Rolls lacked imagination or flavor, and my curry dish was adequate.  We were disappointed, but will try again in hopes that we just hit an off night.

data.title: seems authentic
data.text:
Close your eyes.  Old Chinese restaurant complete with doorway dragons.  Believable patina of dirt lite.  Pho is very good.  Fried noodle dish looks promising.
In a mixed racial neighborhood.  Neighbors include a check cashing, and a rent-to-own store.
Small strip mall also has  Thai and China places.

data.title: Best Thai Food in town.
data.text: Some of the best Thai food in town. Don't be put off by the Low Cost Spay Clinic next door. I find it funny. Their food is tasty and reasonably priced.

data.title: Good food, vegetarian options; Service is not always great
data.text: One of several very good restaurants of its type in Des Moines. Service is sometimes informal, and the wait ataff can be hard to locate if its not busy, but the food it good and reasonably priced.

data.title: Great Place
data.text: Every time I have gone the food has been fresh and perfectly prepared. The service is fast and friendly as well.

data.title: Amazing!
data.text: My friend and I loved our lunch here. I had the Chicken Pho and she had a curry dish.   Both were out of this world.  The lettuce wraps were amazing.  We also tried the pineapple sticky rice and mango sticky rice. Soooo great!  Can't wait to go back again. The waiter was soooo nice. Felt like we were in his home.

data.title: Excellent food and service
data.text: To start off a friend and I were going here because of the reviews we wanted to make sure we tried a lot of different things, to start off we got the sampler appetizer which almost everything was amazing the spring rolls were the only thing we didn't care for for the reason for that is a lot of rice in it tasted like cous cous which I don't care for, after that we got the chicken wings I would have to say the best wings I have had around here then we had the satay chicken smaller portion but amazing, for our main courses we had the pad Thai and a Mongolian beef pad Thai is sweet and very good we got a 2 spicy which was mild we like jalapeño hot and maybe little hotter the Mongolian beef did not have many onions like I like but was still very tasty. I will be back here again the waiter was very helpful and very attentive, my drink was never empty and he knew just by watching us if we needed help. Prices are very cheap for the quality of food that you get, if you get a chance make sure to visit this place you won't be disappointed.

data.title: Excellent!
data.text: One of the best Thai places in the metro area.  So many wonderful items on the menu that a list isn't fair.  Try it, you won't be disappointed.

data.title: An affordale family place - old school mom and pop chefs and owners and no corkage fee
data.text: The food is great.... homemade... Pho is wonderful and they will prepare however you like.  The stock is made from scratch by the family.  The Pad Thai is outstanding and the sauce in it is a wonderful creation from the  owner. The curries are all good my favorites  are the green curry flounder and the red curry chicken.... you can get it as spicy as you like. They also make Laotian food as well. If you talk to the owner he will get you some Korean food as well... I have requested in advance Bulgogi and Kalbi and he ordered them and they were great! The other thing is there is no corkage fee... so bring some wine or beer and enjoy a nice dinner for a great price.

data.title: Good Thai and Vietnamese Cuisine
data.text:
I've enjoyed Indian and Southeast Asian food for a long time.  Had the real thing while serving in that part of the world (East Timor).  One of my favorite dishes is Tom Yum soup.  It's hard to get the authentic version here in America but Cafe Fuzion has it pretty much as I remember it.  (Maybe a few ingredients are hard to get here and regional versions do differ.)  Spicy and tasty.  Also enjoyed the curries (including the tofu), the Pad Thai and the various spring rolls. Courteous service and generous portions.  Worth coming back to.

Note:  They will vary the degree of hotness from one to five.  Five is spicy for sure but I like it.

data.title: Cute place, good vegetarian options
data.text: This place had all kinds of Vietnamese, Thai and pho. The portions are huge and the prices are very reasonable. We got our food to go and the man that helped us was very friendly and the food came out fast and hot.

data.title: Yummmmmy
data.text: The food is excellent, especially the yellow curry with vegetables and tofu. Not sure what they do to the tofu and I would never describe tofu as succulent however the tofu at fusion is. The service is prompt at the waitstaff friendly. I do not live in Des Moines but come through every three months or so on business, they remember me! Found this gem three years ago and have never had a bad meal yet. When are you going to move to Burlington Iowa? (lol)
